channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Institutions are Hungry for Risk
item.description: Hey, Ross here! Funding spreads—essentially the cost of borrowing to trade futures—are climbing again after a mid-November dip. This surge reflects increasing demand from professional investors, signaling that institutions are back in risk-taking mode. The pullback may be over, but the opportunity is just beginning. In today’s Insight, I explain why this is a trend you don’t want to ignore. The post The Institutions are Hungry for Risk appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: This Divergence Opportunity is Back
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The "smart money" is leaning bullish, with institutional investors showing a significantly positive bull-bear spread. Meanwhile, individual investors are leaning bearish, with more bears than bulls among them. This stark divergence between the pros and the crowd presents a major opportunity for savvy traders. What’s driving this split—and how can you take advantage? I break it all down in today’s Insight. The post This Divergence Opportunity is Back appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: New All-Time Highs for Small Caps?
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The small-cap Russell 2000 has been lagging behind other major indexes, still sitting below its 2021 highs. But as the chart shows, it’s now on the verge of a breakout. If it clears those highs, the potential upside for small-cap traders like us could be massive. Here’s the thing, though—you don’t need to wait for the breakout to act. I explain why in today’s Insight. The post New All-Time Highs for Small Caps? appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: What the Market has in Store for December
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The Equal-Weight S&P 500 Index (RSP) just hit a new high, even as the traditional S&P 500 lags behind its mid-November levels. This flip is rare in this bull market, where larger-cap names typically lead the way. But something is shifting beneath the surface, and it could have major implications for how you trade. I break it all down in today’s Insight. The post What the Market has in Store for December appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .
